programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -63kg, Men's -81kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -63kg and Men's -81kg Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena, Paris. At the Women's -63kg, Andreja Leski (SLO) claimed the Gold medal, Prisca Awiti Alcaraz (MEX) won the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Laura Fazliu (KOS) and Clarisse Agbegnenou (FRA). At the Men's -81kg,Takanori Nagase (JPN) won the Gold medal, Tato Grigalashvili (GEO) took the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Somon Makhmadbekov (TJK) and Joonhwan Lee (KOR).

programme.title: Men's 4x200m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x200m Freestyle was held on 30/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Great Britain claimed the Gold with a time of 6:59.43, The United States of America took Silver and Australia completed the podium.

programme.title: Meet the transgender swim star who’s earned a spot on the men’s team
programme.desc: Schuyler Bailar is a decorated swimmer who was recruited to Harvard as a female, but has found peace after transitioning to a male.

programme.title: Becoming an Olympic Legend | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after his famous tally of seven Olympic gold medals and seven world records, legendary swimmer Mark Spitz makes an emotional return to Munich Olympic Park and the swimming pool, where his life was changed forever.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: Behind the invincibility of South Korea archery
programme.desc: A look at how the winning combination of old traditions and cutting edge training techniques gave South Korea its archery superiority.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Archery vs Curling Swap with Lisa Unruh & Niklas Edin
programme.desc: Can an Olympic silver medallist archer hit the target on an ice sheet? What happens when a curling champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Women's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Women's Team Archery took place on 28/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, France won Silver, and Turkey won Bronze.

programme.title: South Korea's Olympic Records in Women's Archery
programme.desc: Unique training methods and nerves of steel make South Korea's archers the most accurate and dominant in the world.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Archery vs Curling Swap with Lisa Unruh & Niklas Edin
programme.desc: Can an Olympic silver medallist archer hit the target on an ice sheet? What happens when a curling champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Behind the invincibility of South Korea archery
programme.desc: A look at how the winning combination of old traditions and cutting edge training techniques gave South Korea its archery superiority.

programme.title: Men's Floor, Women's Vault, Men's Pommel Horse | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Artistic Gymnastics session took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 03/08/2024. At the Men's Floor Exercise Final Carlos Edriel Yulo (PHI) won the Gold medal, Artem Dolgopyat (ISR) claimed the Silver, and Jake Jarman (GBR) took the Bronze. At the Women's Vault Final, Simone Biles (USA) won the Gold medal, Rebeca Andrade (BRA) took the Silver, and Jade Carey (USA) claimed the Bronze. And at the Men's Pommel Horse Final, Rhys Mc Clenaghan (IRL) claimed the Gold medal, while Nariman Kurbanov (KAZ) won the Silver and Stephen Nedoroscik (USA) took the Bronze.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Niklas Kaul - medal contender for Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Despite an incredible 2019 season, winning gold at the World Championships and setting a world’s best record, decathlete Niklas Kaul from Germany faced challenges at Tokyo 2020 due to an injury sustained in the high jump event. After focusing on recovery and preparing for future competitions, he reached an impressive 4th place at the European Championships in Roma, which puts him back in a position to medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Men's Shot Put Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Shot Put Final took place on 03/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Ryan Crouser (USA) won the Gold, Joe Kovacs (USA) won the Silver and Rajindra Campbell (JAM) the Bronze.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Women's Triple Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Triple Jump Final took place on 03/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Thea LaFond (DMA) took the Gold with a 15.02m jump. Shanieka Ricketts (JAM) took the Silver and Jasmine Moore (USA) took the Bronze.

programme.title: Gamers Vs: Episode 3
programme.desc: Popular Gamers apply their gaming skills to Olympic sports with the help of world-class athletes and international coaches. Watch them trying the sports of Curling, Archery and Table Tennis.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Archery vs Curling Swap with Lisa Unruh & Niklas Edin
programme.desc: Can an Olympic silver medallist archer hit the target on an ice sheet? What happens when a curling champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Men's Javelin Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Javelin Throw Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Arshad Nadeem (PAK) won the Golden Medal, Neeraj CHOPRA (IND) Silver Medal and Anderson PETERS (GRN) Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Women's Long Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Long Jump Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Tara DAVIS-WOODHALL (USA) won the Gold medal, Malaika MIHAMBO (GER) won the Silver medal and Jasmine MOORE (USA) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Inside the Show | Athing Mu and Tinashe | From The Top
programme.desc: Athing Mu enjoys her ‘front row seats’ to Tinashe’s video streaming concert in one of Downtown LA’s vintage theatres.

programme.title: The Make Over | Athing Mu and Tinashe | From The Top
programme.desc: Music artist Tinashe invites Athing Mu into her world as she prepares for a concert. The track star gets made up by the Tinashe’s glam squad and shows off some dance moves on stage.

programme.title: Teams Acrobatic Routine | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Teams Acrobatic Routine took place at Aquatics Centre, Paris, on 07/08/24. Team People's Republic of China won Gold, United States of America won Silver and Spain completed the podium.

programme.title: Duets Free Routine Final | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Duets Free Routine Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 10/08/24. Liuyi Wang/Quianyi Wang (CHN) won Gold, Kate Shortman/Isabelle Thorpe (GBR) won Silver and Bregje de Brouwer/Noortje de Brouwer (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Athletes Under Fire - Episode 3: Iraq & Syria
programme.desc: Iraqi Paralympian, Ammar Ali, and Syria's only Olympic swimmer, Bayan Jumah, dream of inspiring a new generation of Olympians.

programme.title: JPN-FRA - Men's Team Bronze Medal Match | Table Tennis | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Team Bronze Medal Match Japan v France, at South Paris Arena 4, Paris, on 09/08/24. Final score FRA 3:2 JPN.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: Men's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Men's Team Archery took place on 29/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, The People's Republic of China won Silver, and Mexico won Bronze.

programme.title: Archery vs race walk with Kanie Miki & Tanii Takayuki | Sports Swap Japan
programme.desc: What happens when a race walk champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Gamers Vs: Episode 3
programme.desc: Popular Gamers apply their gaming skills to Olympic sports with the help of world-class athletes and international coaches. Watch them trying the sports of Curling, Archery and Table Tennis.

programme.title: An Se Young (KOR) v He Bing Jiao (CHN) - Women's Singles Gold Medal Match | Badminton | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Women's Singles Gold Medal match between An Se Young (KOR) v He Bing Jiao (CHN) which took place at the Porte de La Chapelle Arena on 05/08/24. An Se Young (KOR) won the match with a final score of 2:0.
The medal ceremony saw An Se Young (KOR) take Gold, He Bing Jiao (CHN) take Silver and Gregoria Tunjung (INA) take the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Jia Min Yeo (SGP) v Dorsa Yavarivafa (EOR) - Women's Singles Group Play | Badminton | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Singles Group Play match between Jia Min Yeo (SGP) v Dorsa Yavarivafa (EOR) took place on 27/07/2024 at La Chapelle Arena. Jia Min Yeo (SGP) won the match with a score of 2:0.

programme.title: Badminton vs Cricket with Srikanth Kidambi and Yuzvendra Chahal | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can cricketers play badminton? And what happens when India’s badminton champion Srikanth Kidambi swaps his racket for a cricket bat?

programme.title: Youth take Centre Stage | The Academy
programme.desc: We head behind the scenes and hang out with of some of India’s rising badminton talent.

programme.title: B-Girls Final | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Girls Final took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 09/08/2024. AMI (JPN) won the Gold, Nicka (LTU) claimed the Silver, and 671 (CHN) won the Bronze.

programme.title: Anatomy of: Skateboard, Badminton and Athletics
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of skateboarder Tom Schaar, badminton player Marcus Ellis, and hurdler and bobsledder Lolo Jones to find our what makes them special at their sports.

programme.title: From NYC to Alaska, meet the pioneers and US champion | Breaking Life
programme.desc: As the birthplace of a global hip-hop movement, we meet some of the pioneers of Breaking in New-York City. While Kid Glyde shares his passion for breaking with the next generation at his Harlem studio, three thousand miles away in Anchorage Alaska, B-Boy Icey Ives, two-time US national champion, melts the ice with his local crew Frozen Flow while being a community leader, a teacher and a role model for the youth living in extremely challenging conditions.

programme.title: French breakers set the scene for Paris 2024 Olympic Games| Breaking Life
programme.desc: France is a cultural melting pot. It’s also one of the biggest countries for Breaking with more than a thousand battles every year and some of the greatest international competitions. It’s also in Paris 2024 that Breaking will make its Olympic debut. Dany Dann came to France from French Guyana to pursue a life in dance. Now, he juggles early morning shifts as a nurse, daily training and being a father – always with an eye on the next battle. Now reigning national champion, he trains with French national team members B-Girl Carlota and B-Boy Marlone for the WDSF World Breaking Championship in Paris.

programme.title: Young breakers take over the streets of Medellin | Breaking Life
programme.desc: Colombia used to be one of the most dangerous countries in the world but has found new life through a revival in urban arts, becoming a global creative mecca. B-Girl Luma and 4Eskuela hip hop school, where she learnt Breaking and is now a teacher, have been instrumental to this change in Medellin (Colombia). But it’s not been an easy journey for Luma who also had her doubts about what she can really achieve through dancing. By winning international dance events around the world, she is now confident it gave her a career and a drive, also when teaching young kids in her neighbourhood. She is keen to participate to Paris 2024.

programme.title: SRB-GER - Men's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Bronze Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. Serbia won the Bronze with a final score SRB 93:83 GER.

programme.title: Manuel: the next big thing in Angola’s favorite sport | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young basketball player from Angola shows us what the sport means to him and dreams of the endelless posibilities the future holds.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Basketball Player: The Incredible Stamina of Laetitia Guapo
programme.desc: We took French 3x3 basketball player Laetitia Guapo and examined her unique physical characteristics in a sports science lab to find out the what it takes to be FIBA's world number 1 ranked female basketball player. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: BEL-AUS - Women's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Bronze Medal Game took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 11/08/2024. Australia won Bronze with a final score AUS 85:81 BEL.

programme.title: Can NBA and Dream Team star Laettner teach this team to win?
programme.desc: Team USA and NBA legend Christian Laettner shows the Garinger High School varsity basketball team how they can improve their game.

programme.title: The story of the basketball legend who never gave up on her Olympic dream
programme.desc: In “The Queen”, Brazilian legend Hortencia Marcari explains why she came out of retirement only months after giving birth.

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Women's Discus Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Discus Throw Final took place on 05/08/2024 at Stade de France. Valarie ALLMAN (USA) won the Gold medal, FENG Bin (CHN) won the Silver medal and Sandra ELKASEVIC (CRO) won the Bronze.

programme.title: The Distance | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The story of an enduring Japanese marathon tradition and a humble champion named Naoko Takahashi who captured her nation’s imagination with a run for the ages at the 2000 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Ethiopia’s Derartu Tulu I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of the first black African female gold medallist Derartu Tulu, who is now leading Ethiopia’s national athletics team.

programme.title: Men's Long Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Long Jump Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 06/08/2024. Miltiadis Tentoglou (GRE) won the Gold with a distance of 8.48m. Wayne Pinnock (JAM) won the Silver, Mattia Furlani (ITA) completed the podium.
